title: Ukraine Brings Back Agonizing Realpolitik Decisions
sub_head: U.S. has to decide whether to foster good relations with unsavory regimes to better confront Russian menace
body:
Thanks to Vladimir Putinâ€™s assault on Ukraine, Cold War echoes can be heard all around: escalating tensions with Moscow, a newly unified Western military alliance, rising defense spending, even a whiff of fear over potential nuclear conflict.
There also is this echo: The U.S. now has to decide whether to return to the days of realpolitik, when it held its nose to foster good relations with unsavory regimes to better confront a larger danger emanating from Russia.
